page.title: 12HOSPITALS IN N.W.NEWCASTLE.
page.content: { St.Nicholas' Hospital}is for the mentally handicapped and the disturbed There are 650 patients and 1500 staff. 60% of the patients are over 60 and the youngest is 18.In the daytime patients do craftwork,go on trips and enjoy a game of bingo.Some patients live in flats where they do their own house work but there is a supervisor living nearby.Visitors to the hospital are made very welcome. The{Sanderson Hospital}was founded in 1888 for crippled children but it is now used for the elderly.It was closed in 1977 but opened again in 1982.There are 60-80 patients between the ages of 60 to 100 and there are 65 nurses and 35 domestic staff.There are day rooms where the patients make jewellery.They also go on trips.There is a rumour about a ghost that hovers above the lift shaft!
